instruction: Write a professional email to: tsaini@sibitalent.com
input: Subject: Re: Urgent Hiring on W2/C2C // Cloud Architecture Analyst @ Remote
output:
*Adam Peacock*

Principal Architect
Office: +1-214-810-5701


On Thu, Jul 10, 2025 at 3:41 PM Tushar Saini <tsaini@sibitalent.com> wrote:

> Hello Adam Peacock
>
> My name is Tushar Saini and I am a Staffing Specialist at Sibitalent. I am
> reaching out to you on an exciting job opportunity with one of our clients.
>
> *Job Description*
>
> *Job Position: *Cloud Architecture Analyst
>
> *Job Type:* W2/C2C
>
> *Location:* Remote
>
> *Duration:* 6+ month Contract
>
> *Implementation: *Persistent Systems
>
> *Cloud Architecture Analyst: *
>
> We are seeking a skilled and experienced Cloud Architecture Analyst to
> join our dynamic team. As a leading company in the healthcare industry, we
> are committed to modernizing our legacy applications and addressing complex
> business challenges through innovative solutions, including our strategic
> cloud migration program. If you are a certified cloud practitioner with a
> strong background in Enterprise Architecture principles, healthcare domain
> expertise, and cloud technologies, we invite you to be a part of our
> transformative journey.
>
> As an Enterprise Architect, you will play a pivotal role in driving our
> technology and business strategies forward. Your primary responsibilities
> will involve supporting the cloud migration program, devising realistic and
> achievable solutions to intricate business problems, and leveraging your
> cloud certification to guide the implementation of Enterprise Architecture
> principles across the organization.
>
> *Deliverables *
>
>    - Cloud solution patterns, cloud security, resiliency & observability,
>    CMM architecture review, and current state & future state cloud
>    architecture, create future infrastructure cost estimate for accurate
>    forecasting
>    - Additionally, they facilitate collaboration between teams, Assess
>    the business needs, identify potential risks, develop detailed solutions
>    and designs, propose architectural changes to optimize cloud solutions,
>    align with enterprise cloud migration strategies, collaborate with vendors,
>    engineering teams, and enterprise/application architects
>    - Analysis of existing cloud infrastructure
>    - Analysis and evaluation of existing cloud infrastructure
>    - Providing recommendations for improvements.
>
> *Responsibilities: *
>
>    - Develop and implement comprehensive cloud architecture strategies
>    that align with business objectives and technological advancements.
>    - Leverage your in-depth knowledge of cloud and other architectural
>    frameworks to design scalable and efficient cloud solutions.
>    - Provide industry, technology, and market expertise to support
>    strategic business decisions for cloud investments.
>    - Decompose complex business strategies into initiatives that
>    translate into clear, actionable cloud architecture roadmaps.
>    - Collaborate across organizational silos to resolve dependencies and
>    accelerate cloud architecture and solution decisions.
>    - Work with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for cloud
>    adoption, streamline processes, and enhance operational efficiency.
>    - Apply your expertise in cloud architecture principles to ensure
>    seamless integration of cloud solutions into existing systems and
>    workflows.
>    - Lead the evaluation and selection of emerging cloud technologies,
>    ensuring alignment with business requirements and industry standards.
>    - Provide technical guidance and leadership to development teams,
>    ensuring compliance with cloud architectural standards and best practices.
>    - Define governance and security practices for cloud initiatives,
>    ensuring adherence to industry regulations and company policies.
>    - Monitor and evaluate the performance of implemented cloud solutions,
>    continuously making improvements as necessary.
>    - Share your knowle

instruction: Write a professional email to: devsarang@steneral.com
input: Subject: Re: Urgent Role || Lead Engineer– Infrastructure Operations || Remote || Citizen, GC
output:
Interested but I'm very busy so please use email. If this is a good match
then we can chat.

//adam

*Adam Peacock*

Principal Architect
Office: +1-214-810-5701


On Tue, Jul 1, 2025 at 3:19 PM Devsarang Singh <devsarang@steneral.com>
wrote:

> Hello Adam,
>
>
> Greetings from Steneral Consulting
>
> We have an urgent need for an *Lead Engineer– Infrastructure Operations *for
> one of our clients in *Remote*. Please go through the below requirement
> if you are open for projects and interested in the below requirement,
> Please respond back with latest resume along with the details ASAP.
>
> *Work Authorization: Citizen*
>
> *Position: Lead Engineer– Infrastructure Operations*
>
> *Location: Remote*
>
> *Duration:6 Months*
>
> *Interview: Video*
>
> *Job description:*
>
> We are looking for a highly skilled *Engineer* with deep experience in *eCommerce
> infrastructure, AWS cloud-native services, and CDN/WAF management, ideally
> Fastly VCL (Varnish Configuration Language) and NG-WAF.* You will play a
> key role in maintaining, optimizing, and evolving our digital commerce
> platform to deliver fast, secure, and scalable customer experiences.
>
> *Responsibilities*
>
>    - Design, deploy, and maintain AWS infrastructure to support
>    high-availability, high-traffic eCommerce applications
>    - Manage and configure *Fastly CDN* services, including writing,
>    testing, and optimizing *VCL code* for caching, routing, and security
>    use cases
>    - Collaborate with developers and site reliability engineers to
>    improve site performance, latency, monitoring, alerting, and uptime
>    - Implement infrastructure-as-code (IaC) using tools like Terraform,
>    CloudFormation, or AWS CDK
>    - Monitor system performance and troubleshoot infrastructure issues
>    across AWS and CDN layers
>    - Automate infrastructure operations, deployment workflows, health
>    checks and incident response
>    - Support CI/CD pipelines and application rollouts in collaboration
>    with DevOps and engineering teams
>    - Maintain security best practices including IAM, network controls,
>    and data protection standards
>    - Participate in on-call rotation and incident management for
>    infrastructure-related issues
>
> *Required Qualifications*
>
>    - *5+ years of experience with AWS (EC2, S3, CloudFront, Lambda, API
>    Gateway, RDS, Route 53, etc.)*
>    - *2+ years of experience configuring and managing Fastly CDN,
>    including custom VCL scripting and Distributed Compute services and/or
>    applicable web development experience*
>    - *Strong knowledge of web caching, HTTP/2, TLS, and CDN optimization
>    techniques*
>    - *Solid scripting and automation experience with Node.js, Bash,
>    Python, or similar languages*
>    - *Familiarity with containerization technologies and certificate
>    management (Docker, ECS, EKS)*
>    - *Experience implementing infrastructure-as-code (e.g., Terraform,
>    CloudFormation)*
>    - *Experienence with monitoring and observability tools (e.g.,
>    Datadog, CloudWatch, New Relic)*
>    - *Understanding of CI/CD processes and tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub
>    Actions, CodePipeline)*
>    - *Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, especially in
>    high-traffic environments*
>    - *Excellent communication and documentation skills*
>
> *Preferred Qualifications*
>
>    - Experience in a large-scale *retail or eCommerce environment*
>    - *Node.js experience preferred*
>    - Signal based *WAF management preferred *(ex: Signal Sciences)
>    - Knowledge of *edge security practices such as WAF configu*ration,
>    bot protection, or TLS management
>    - Experience with performance tuning and synthetic monitoring
>    - *AWS certifications* (e.g., Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer,
>    Cloud Architect)
>
>
>
> *Thanks & Regards,*
>
>
>
> *Devsarang Singh*
>
> Talen

instruction: Write a professional email to: naresh@activesoftinc.com
input: Subject: Re: Remote Position: Infrastructure Transformation Architect - 6+months Contract
output:
Interested but I'm very busy so please use email. If this is a good match
then we can chat.

//adam

*Adam Peacock*

Principal Architect
Office: +1-214-810-5701


On Thu, Jun 26, 2025 at 10:40 AM Naresh Ramavath | Activesoft Inc <
naresh@activesoftinc.com> wrote:

> *Hi Adam*
>
> *Please let me know your thoughts about this role*
>
>
>
> *Infrastructure Transformation Architect*
>
> *6+months Contract *
>
> *Remote Position*
>
>
>
>
>
> *Experience Required: SHOULD HAVE Minimum 15 Years*
>
>
>
> * JOB DESCRIPTION:*
>
> Has an ability to gather application functionality and non-functional
> requirement understand it and convert them into the overall IT
> infrastructure designs and implementation solutions for client's Business
> services
>
> Has experience in DC transformation projects , which involved environment
> analysis, right sizing for future, designed and implemented on public and
> On prem cloud. Post implementation migration of Virtual and physical infra
> from as-is environment to newly build infrastructure on public/ Private
> cloud.
>
>    - Hands on experience in Cloud Build projects, Cloud
>    Migration/Transformation,
>    - Ability to understand business requirements and transform it into a
>    robust and efficient solution at optimized efforts and within budgeted costs
>    - Evaluate technology, market trends and industry, identify
>    prospective impact on business
>    - Experience in building solution around Nutanix, HyperV based on
>    on-premises hyperconverged infrastructure
>    - Craft the Infrastructure migration strategies, principles, and
>    high-level design document.
>    - Develop processes and templates that are innovative without being
>    stifling and restrictive.
>    - Review and Stitch infrastructure low level design documents
>    which includes compute, storage and backup, Database, networks, and security
>    - Develop implementation plan for infrastructure architecture on basis
>    of IT strategies and business requirements
>    - Evaluate and recommend infrastructure solutions to best meet the
>    seamless migration need of the business services.
>    -  Assure that the most appropriate IT practices measures are in place.
>    - Strong technical knowledge and hands on experience on virtualization
>    technologies like
>       - VMware Infrastructure 4.x/5.x/6.x, VMware SRM, VMware Realize,
>       VMware Licensing
>       - Hyper-V 2008R2/2012R2, System Center Virtual Machine Manager,
>       Microsoft Licensing
>       - Oracle Virtualization (OVM)
>       - Red Hat Virtualization
>    - Strong technical knowledge and hands on experience on Microsoft
>    technologies like
>       - Windows server 2008/2008R2/2012/..2022 and Licensing
>       - Active Directory Services
>       - Federation Services
>       - Failover Clustering Services
>       - Microsoft Exchange
>    - Strong technical knowledge and hands on experience on Unix Operating
>    environment like
>       - Oracle Solaris
>       - HP-UX
>       - IBM AIX
>       - Linux (RHEL, OEL, Ubuntu etc)
>       - Oracle Engineered System
>    - Technical knowledge on AD/LDAP/NTP/SMTP services with upgradation,
>    Migration
>    - Strong technical knowledge on Server, compute, storage and backup
>    technologies like HP, Oracle, Cisco, DELL Blade server technologies,
>    Virtual Connect technologies, etc.
>    - VMware VCF , NSX , Aria , Infoblox , Tenium , Chef , HP & Dell
>    hardware
>    - Good understanding of cloud technologies and its integration.
>    - Good Communication skills.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> *Thanks & Regards,*
>
>
>
> *Naresh Ramavath*
>
> *Celebrating 18 Years of Excellence!*
> Phone:  404-496-4368 Ext 416
>
> Call or Text : 336-499-1614
>
> *naresh@activesoftinc.com <naresh@activesoftinc.com>*

> <https://www.linkedin.com/in/micah-roesken/>*
>
> *Principal Technical Consultant - Cloud / Platform Engineering*
> *Dallas, Texas *
> *Full Time *
> We build platforms for digital business. By weaving together advances in
> cloud infrastructure, automation and analytics, and software delivery, we
> help enterprises deliver on the promise of digital transformation.
> We prioritize creating a culture of belonging, where all perspectives and
> voices are represented, valued, respected, and heard. We create spaces to
> empower everyone to speak up, make change, and drive the culture.
> *Principal Technical Consultant - Cloud / Platform Engineering *
> Serving as a technical thought leader and SME for our ecosystem of
> partners, customers, and service providers in the realm of Modern Apps &
> Platform Engineering, in addition to serving as a leader of other
> teammates. The Principal Technical Consultant works as part of the
> consulting team to lead the development, design, implementation, and
> engagement leader of client solutions. Principal Technical Consultants
> manage, mentor and delegate to engineers on a project basis, manage and
> maintain career advancement plans for the team, and within the broader
> organization as it relates to internal initiatives and indirect project
> support. This role requires a strategic mindset, strong leadership
> abilities, and deep technical proficiency across various domains.
> *Responsibilities*
> · Ensure projects are delivered on time, at the highest quality standards
> while exceeding client expectations.
> · Design and implement complex, mission-critical transformational
> enterprise grade technical solutions for clients.
> · Build and maintain strong client relationships, drive business growth,
> and identify opportunities for upselling and cross-selling
> · Develop high quality deliverables and presentations for Client
> engineering teams and senior leaders, this can include both technical
> documentation and non-technical documentation.
> · Collaborate with clients to understand their technical challenges and

instruction: Write a professional email to: vijaykirand@tanuinfotech.com
input: Subject: Re: Cloud Engineer - Remote
output:
*Adam Peacock*

Principal Architect
Office: +1-214-810-5701

On Tue, Jun 24, 2025, 8:35 AM Vijay Doollapalli <
vijaykirand@tanuinfotech.com> wrote:

> Hello Adam,
> I hope you're doing well.
>
> This is Vijaykiran from Tanu Infotech. We are currently hiring for the
> following role and would like to share the details with you. If you are
> interested, please feel free to reach out to me at
> vijaykirand@tanuinfotech.com.
>
>
>
> *Role: **Cloud Engineer*
> *Location: (Remote)*
>
>
>
> *Your Impact*
>
> We are seeking a highly skilled and certified Cloud Engineer with deep
> expertise in both Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Microsoft Azure. This role
> is responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining secure,
> scalable, and highly available cloud environments across both platforms.
> The ideal candidate will have a strong background in cloud architecture,
> automation, and infrastructure as code, and will work closely with
> DevSecOps, Security & Compliance, and Cybersecurity Analysts to ensure our
> cloud infrastructure meets the highest standards of reliability, security,
> and compliance.
>
>
>
> *Key Responsibilities:*
>
>    - Design, deploy, and manage multi-cloud infrastructure (AWS and
>    Azure) with a focus on scalability, reliability, and security.
>    - Collaborate with DevSecOps teams to implement CI/CD pipelines and
>    automate infrastructure provisioning using tools like Terraform,
>    CloudFormation, Bicep, or Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates.
>    - Partner with Security and Compliance teams to ensure adherence to
>    regulatory requirements (e.g., HIPAA, SOC 2, ISO 27001).
>    - Work with Cybersecurity Analysts to monitor and respond to security
>    threats, vulnerabilities, and incidents.
>    - Implement and manage high availability, disaster recovery, and
>    auto-scaling solutions across cloud platforms.
>    - Manage and optimize cloud-native managed services such as RDS, S3,
>    DynamoDB, Azure SQL, Azure App Services, and others.
>    - Optimize cloud costs through resource right-sizing, reserved
>    instances, and usage monitoring.
>    - Maintain and improve monitoring, logging, and alerting systems using
>    tools like CloudWatch, Azure Monitor, AWS Config, and Microsoft Defender
>    for Cloud.
>    - Document infrastructure designs, procedures, and best practices.
>
>
>
> *Required Qualifications:*
>
>    - Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or
>    related field (or equivalent experience).
>    - 3–5+ years of experience in cloud engineering with a focus on AWS
>    and Azure.
>    - Certifications such as:
>    - AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate or Professional
>    - Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert
>    - Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools (e.g., Terraform,
>    CloudFormation, Bicep).
>    - Strong understanding of networking, IAM, VPC/subnet design, and
>    security best practices in both AWS and Azure.
>    - Experience working in DevSecOps environments and collaborating with
>    security teams.
>    - Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Bash, or
>    PowerShell.
>    - AWS Certified Security – Specialty or Azure Security Engineer
>    Associate.is a plus
>    - Experience managing multi-account/multi-subscription environments
>    and landing zone frameworks.
>    - Familiarity with SIEM tools, compliance frameworks, and incident
>    response.
>
> --
>
>
>
> <https://www.linkedin.com/company/tanu-infotech/about/>
>
> *Vijay Kiran*
>
> *Talent Acquisition Specialist | Aerospace & Defense*
>
> Email: Vijaykirand@tanuinfotech.com
>
> Tanu Infotech, INC
>
>
> 360 Bloomfield Ave STE 301 Windsor CT 06095
>
> Staffing / Recruitment / Consulting / Offshore
>
> Minority and Women-Owned Business Enterprise ("MWBE")
>
> *** Tanu Infotech is Celebrating 10 years in IT Industry***

instruction: Write a professional email to: manish.tyagi@steneral.com
input: Subject: Re: Urgent Role || DevOps Solution Lead/Architect || Plano, TX (Onsite Role)
output:
Interested but I'm very busy so please use email. If this is a good match
then we can chat.

//adam

*Adam Peacock*

Principal Architect
Office: +1-214-810-5701


On Fri, Jun 13, 2025 at 10:49 AM Lead -- Manish Tyagi <
manish.tyagi@steneral.com> wrote:

> Hello Adam Peacock,
>
>
> Greetings from *Steneral Consulting*
>
>
>
> We have an urgent need for an *DevOps Solution Lead/Architect* for one of
> our clients in*  Plano, TX (Onsite Role). *Please go through the below
> requirement if you are open for projects and interested in the below
> requirement, Please respond back with latest resume along with the details
> ASAP.
>
>
>
> *Rate: $75/hr on 1099*
>
> *Client: Toyota Motor North America*
>
>
>
> *Work Authorization: GC, USC*
>
>
>
>
>
> *Position: DevOps Solution Lead/Architect Location: Plano, TX (Onsite
> Role) Duration: 6+Months*
>
>
>
> *Interview: Phone and Skype*
>
>
>
> *Key Highlights:*
>
>    - *Impact:* Play a critical role in shaping the future of mobility by
>    ensuring the availability, performance, security, and scalability of
>    Toyota's AWS production systems.
>    - *Cutting-Edge Tech: Work with a modern tech stack, including AWS,
>    Kubernetes, Terraform, Gitlab CI/Argo CD, and more.*
>    - *Growth:* Be part of a collaborative and respectful environment
>    where you can learn, grow, and mentor team members.
>    - *Stability:* 12-month contract with a high likelihood of extension.
>    - *Team:* Join a collaborative, respectful team at one of the most
>    admired brands in the world.
>
> *Job Description:*
>
> We are looking for a DevOps Solution Lead/Architect to be based on-site in
> Plano, TX to help with Toyota's connected vehicle technology. T*his
> individual will be responsible for the deployment, automation, management,
> and maintenance of our AWS cloud-based production systems. You will
> troubleshoot issues, debug codebases, and ensure the security and
> scalability of our platform. Additionally, you will mentor technical teams
> and provide guidance on testing strategies and performance tuning.*
>
>
>
> *Responsibilities:*
>
>    - Design, implement, and manage AWS cloud-based production systems.
>    - Troubleshoot and resolve complex issues related to connected vehicle
>    technology.
>    - Automate infrastructure and deployment processes using Terraform,
>    Gitlab CI/Argo CD.
>    - Ensure the availability, performance, security, and scalability of
>    AWS production systems.
>    - Collaborate with development teams to improve code quality and
>    testability.
>    - Provide guidance and mentorship to technical teams on DevOps best
>    practices.
>    - Define and communicate technical solutions to both technical and
>    non-technical audiences.
>
> *Must-Have Qualifications:*
>
>    - *5-10 years of experience in Information Technology.*
>    - *2-3+ years of experience in an Architecture environment.*
>    - *Mastery in one of the SecDevOps practices (IaC-Terraform,
>    Cloud-AWS, CICD-Git/Argo, microservices architecture deployment (primarily
>    Kubernetes)) with awareness about site reliability engineering principles.*
>    - *Strong hands-on experience with AWS Services (IAM, VPC, EKS,
>    CloudFront, APIGW).*
>    - *Proficiency in IaC using Terraform is a must.*
>    - *Experience with CI (Gitlab CI preferred) and CD (Argo CD
>    preferred).*
>    - *Kubernetes debugging experience.*

instruction: Write a professional email to: selenavpeacock@gmail.com
input: Subject: Fwd: 2023 CA FRTB tax adjustment
output:
We owe CA additional $5075 for late payment penalties.

*Adam Peacock*

Principal Architect
Office: +1-214-810-5701


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Adam Peacock <alawson@aqorn.com>
Date: Mon, Jun 9, 2025 at 10:14 AM
Subject: Re: 2023 CA FRTB tax adjustment
To: Nima Rezaei <nima@nimacpas.com>


Okay appreciate your review, we already paid. Will submit the balance,
Thanks Nima.

//adam

*Adam Peacock*

Principal Architect
Office: +1-214-810-5701


On Mon, Jun 9, 2025 at 10:10 AM Nima Rezaei <nima@nimacpas.com> wrote:

> Hi Adam,
>
>
>
> This agrees with everything except that they added some penalties for late
> fiings, etc.
>
>
>
> They added $5699 in penalties while we reported $624.  Difference of $5075.
>
>
>
> I had you owing $15387 but they have you owing $20461.
>
>
>
> If you paid the $15387 already, just pay them $5075.
>
>
>
> We knew that they were going to make adjustments.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> With Respect,
>
>
>
> Nima Rezaei, CPA, MBA
>
> *nima@nimacpas.com <nima@nimacpas.com>*
>
> *www.nimacpas.com <http://www.nimacpas.com/>*
>
>
>
>
>
>   *1540 Eureka Rd, #104*
>
> *  Roseville, CA  95661*
>
> *  (916) 782 – NIMA*
>
>
>
> How to create generational wealth and how to build wealth like the 1%
> https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/nima-rezaei-save-on-taxes-by-utilizing-tax-strategies/id1531901889?i=1000584632948
> <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__podcasts.apple.com_us_podcast_nima-2Drezaei-2Dsave-2Don-2Dtaxes-2Dby-2Dutilizing-2Dtax-2Dstrategies_id1531901889-3Fi-3D1000584632948&d=DwMF-g&c=euGZstcaTDllvimEN8b7jXrwqOf-v5A_CdpgnVfiiMM&r=DTQ6xY793SZ8zsWLmOUA6RkrRakHshlw0ZETu3ALLRc&m=p09sNrF2Ubz-mFi2kxwi2gd-G18mh5fyt99GrFW-UXVAJztzqnQ0rq3_r6f0kri6&s=zdi-Gk0PK3eLgubdjIHOpSbTTh48Gdni8nVWVD3Jxkg&e=>

instruction: Write a professional email to: empowerprofessionals@jobdivaemail.com
input: Subject: Re: Lead System Engineering - 100% Remote
output:
Interested but I'm very busy so please use email. If this is a good match
then we can chat.

//adam

*Adam Peacock*

Principal Architect
Office: +1-214-810-5701


On Thu, Jun 5, 2025 at 2:51 PM Aditya Singh Thakur <
Aditya.T@empowerprofessionals.com> wrote:

> Hello,
>
> I am Aditya working with Empower, we have an urgent role to fill, please
> find the job description below and let me know if anyone is interested.
>
> Role: Lead System Engineering
> Locations: 100% Remote
> Duration: 12+ Months Contract
>
> Job Description:
> •              Automation of infrastructure delivery with configuration
> orchestration and management solutions (e.g. Ansible, Puppet,
> Terraform).
> •              Understanding of coding practices and developing in a
> preferred scripting language (e.g. PowerShell, Python, UNIX Shell
> Scripting).
> •              Experience with Operating System hardening practices as
> well as methodologies for templating deployments from a set of
> standardized images.
> •              Linux and Windows systems engineering principles.
> •              Java application server (e.g. JBOSS EAP, Tomcat)
> implementation.
> •              Compute virtualization for both in-house developed and
> commercial off the shelf software leveraging VMware’s technology stack
> and converged storage solutions utilizing Pure Storage.
>
> Ideal candidate have experience with one or more of the following as
> well:
> •              Middleware solutions (e.g. IBM MQ, Kafka, Confluent).
> •              DevOps principles and CI/CD solutions (e.g. GitLab,
> Jenkins).
> •              Software engineering with an emphasis on Java software
> development.
> •              Containerization of applications, preferably with an
> emphasis towards Kubernetes, specifically OpenShift.
> •              Implementation of service catalog automation for delivery
> of infrastructure services.
> •              Incident triage including scope determination, impact
> assessment and service restoration
>
>
> --
> Best Regards
> Aditya Singh Thakur
> Empower Professionals Inc
> Aditya.T@empowerprofessionals.com
> Direct: 732-356-8008 x 388
> 100 Franklin Square Drive – Suite 104 | Somerset, NJ 08873
> www.empowerprofessionals.com
>
> Certified NJ and NY Minority Business Enterprise (NMSDC)
> To subscribe or unsubscribe:
> https://send.empowerprofessionals.com/newsletter/subscribe/647186e8-bcb0-4f73-8f80-cb3daff9ad90
>
>

>
> *Sr. Cloud Operations Engineer*
>
>
>
> Our client is in search of a Senior Cloud Operations Engineer to lead the
> design, implementation, and optimization of enterprise-scale OpenStack
> infrastructure, ensuring reliability, security, and cost-efficiency across
> hybrid cloud and colocation environments. Your expertise will bridge

> operations to support our virtualization ecosystem.
>
>
>
> RESPONSIBILITIES
>
>
>
> *Infrastructure Design and Deployment*
>
> Deliver resilient OpenStack environments with 99.999% uptime, optimized
> for hybrid cloud workloads.
>
> Architect and manage OpenStack clusters across multiple geo-distributed
> data center environments
>
> Identify, qualitfiy, procure, and manage physical hardware (compute,
> storage, networking) aligned with OpenStack and Ceph storage requirements.
>
>
>
> *Data Center Operations and Capacity Planning*
>
> Collaborate with colocation vendors to ensure power/cooling capacity meets
> workload demands, using DCIM tools for rack-level planning (power, BTU/hr,
> U space)
>
> Conduct quarterly capacity audits to identify resource gaps, depletion
> risks, and upgrade timelines
>
>
>
> *Networking and Security Governance*
>
> Configure routing, SD-WAN integrations, and AWS Direct Connect/VPC
> peering/mesh networking for hybrid cloud connectivity
>
> Implement security standards via OpenStack and Linux capabilities
> (Keystone, Neutron, encrypted Ceph storage, etc).
>
> Perform regular security audits and remediate security findings
>
>
>
> *Automation and Observability*
>
> Develop Ansible playbooks/Terraform modules/MaaS configurations for
> OpenStack component provisioning
>
> Build predictive analytics pipelines using metrics, logs, and traces
>
> Design self-healing workflows for compute and storage failures
>
>
>
> REQUIREMENTS
>
>
>
>    - Proficiency in KVM/QEMU, Ceph, and OpenStack services (Nova,
>    Neutron, Keystone)
>    - Proficiency in infrastructure as code and configuration management
>    tools (Terraform, OpenTofu, Pulumi, Ansible, Salt).
>    - Proficiency in Linux performance analysis (eBPF).
>    - Advanced, at-scale automation of bare-metal provisioning
>    - Hands-on experience with DCIM tools
>    - Hands-on experience with modern observability stacks (APM,
>    OpenTelemetry, Grafana, Prometheus, Loki).
>    - Experience in evaluating, qualifying, and managing networking
>    hardware and capacity planning.

output:

>
> Greetings from Anveta,
>

>
>
> *Job Title: Sr. Solution Architect*
>
> *Location:* Remote (Must work in PST time zone)
> *Type:* Contract (12 months)
> *Company Type:* Product-Based Company
>
>
>
>
> *Job Description:*
>
> We are seeking a highly skilled *Sr. Solution Architect* to join a
> leading product-based company. This is a remote opportunity, but the
> candidate must be available to work in the *Pacific Standard Time (PST)*
> zone.
>
> As a Sr. Solution Architect, you will be responsible for designing
> scalable, high-performance solutions, collaborating with cross-functional
> teams, and aligning technology initiatives with business goals.
>
>
>
> *Key Responsibilities:*
>
>    - Lead the design and architecture of complex, enterprise-level
>    solutions.
>    - Collaborate with engineering, product, and business teams to define
>    technical requirements and solution strategies.
>    - Evaluate and recommend tools, technologies, and frameworks.
>    - Create architecture blueprints, technical specifications, and
>    integration strategies.
>    - Guide development teams on architecture best practices, security,
>    and performance.
>    - Ensure solutions are aligned with long-term business and technology
>    goals.
>    - Provide thought leadership and mentorship to technical teams.
>
>
>
> *Qualifications:*
>
>    - 10+ years of experience in software engineering, with at least 5
>    years in a solution architecture role.
>    - Proven experience designing solutions for product-based companies.
>    - Expertise in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
>    - Strong understanding of microservices architecture, API design, and
>    system integration.
>    - Hands-on experience with modern programming languages and frameworks.
>    - Solid understanding of DevOps, CI/CD, and agile methodologies.
>    - Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
>
>
>
> *Nice to Have:*
>
>    - Experience in SaaS or enterprise product development.
>    - Familiarity with security and compliance standards.
>    - Background in data architecture or AI/ML integration is a plus.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>

output:

*Adam Peacock*

Office: +1-214-810-5701


On Thu, May 29, 2025 at 12:37 PM Khayal Abbas <
khayal.abbas@scalable-systems.com> wrote:

> Hello Adam Peacock
>
> My name is Khayal Abbas and I am a Staffing Specialist at Scalable
> Systems. I am reaching out to you on an exciting job opportunity with one
> of our clients.
>
>
> *Job Title:*
>
> *Software Engineer – Private Cloud / Virtualization*
> *Location:*
>
> Sunnyvale, CA
> *Employment Type:* Contract
> *Client:* TCS/Confidential
> *Status:* Open
> ------------------------------
> *Job Summary:*
>
> We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced *Software Engineer –
> Private Cloud / Virtualization* to join a dynamic team focused on
> building and managing a large-scale enterprise-grade *private cloud
> infrastructure* within Cisco's data centers. This role is key to
> delivering a near-public-cloud experience internally through full software
> automation, high availability, and lifecycle monitoring. You will work on
> next-generation hybrid-cloud compute platforms powering Cisco’s
> mission-critical applications.
> ------------------------------
> *Key Responsibilities:*
>
>    -
>
>    Design, develop, and maintain software to enhance the *functionality,
>    reliability, and manageability* of private cloud platforms built on
>    *OpenStack* and *Bare Metal* infrastructure.
>    -
>
>    Automate deployment, monitoring, and scaling processes using *Infrastructure
>    as Code (IaC)* with tools like *Ansible* and *Python*.
>    -
>
>    Ensure platform *performance, scalability, and security* by applying
>    DevOps best practices and CI/CD pipeline integration.
>    -
>
>    Set and manage *SLOs*, and implement robust *monitoring and logging*
>    solutions.
>    -
>
>    Engage in technology evaluations, provide technical leadership, and
>    influence platform architecture decisions.
>    -
>
>    Collaborate cross-functionally with infrastructure, security, and
>    software engineering teams to ensure seamless integration and service
>    delivery.
>
> ------------------------------
> *Required Skills & Experience:*
>
>    -
>
>    *8+ years* of IT experience, with *5+ years* in *virtualization,
>    private cloud, or cloud infrastructure engineering*.
>    -
>
>    Proven experience in:
>    -
>
>       *OpenStack* and/or *Bare Metal infrastructure*
>       -
>
>       *KVM* virtualization
>       -
>
>       *Ansible*, *Python scripting*
>       -
>
>    Strong understanding of *CI/CD pipelines*, *DevOps tools*, and *infrastructure
>    automation*.
>    -
>
>    Knowledge of cloud concepts and hybrid-cloud infrastructure in large
>    enterprise environments.
>    -
>
>    Ability to develop and support distributed systems with a focus on *resilience,
>    observability, and automation*.
>    -
>
>    Experience setting and measuring *SLOs* for critical infrastructure
>    services.
>
> ------------------------------
> *Preferred Qualifications:*
>
>    -
>
>    Experience working in *large-scale enterprise environments*.
>    -
>
>    Familiarity with *monitoring tools* such as Prometheus, Grafana, or
>    Splunk.
>    -
>
>    Exposure to *multi-cloud architectures* and *cloud-native technologies*
>    .
>    -
>
>    Strong communication skills and ability to work in agile and
>    cross-functional teams.
>
>

>
> Full Name:

> deployments, monitoring, and management of cloud resources. Serve as a
> subject-matter expert for Azure cloud and security, mentoring team members

>       - 5+ years of experience in cloud architecture, with

> Adam,
>
> We're in the home stretch! Very positive feedback from the panel you met
> with this afternoon.
>
> The last step in this process is a CCAT assessment. Unni said that you are
> expecting it but please let me know if you have any questions. It typically
> occurs earlier on in the process but isn't pass or fail. Your results are
> sent to you at the end.
>
> It takes about 25 minutes to complete. Please see additional details below
> and let me know when you're able to knock this out.
>
> *https://www.ondemandassessment.com/link/index/JB-1R307O6WA?u=1052031
> <https://www.ondemandassessment.com/link/index/JB-1R307O6WA?u=1052031>*
>
>
>
> *Details on the Assessment*
>
> At Cytracom, we believe in making the interview process as insightful and
> effective as possible and aim to hire individuals who are looking to
> advance their professional careers. To achieve this, we utilize a CCAT
> (Cognitive and Critical Thinking Assessment) and a personality test as part
> of our evaluation process. These assessments are not meant to judge or
> categorize candidates as pass or fail; instead, they serve as valuable
> tools to gain a deeper understanding of how you prefer to work and process
> information. The process only takes about 25 minutes. We view this as an
> opportunity to have a more productive and engaging discussion during the
> interview, ensuring that we can better align your strengths and preferences
> with the right role within our organization. Embracing these assessments
> allows us to make the most informed decisions and helps you put your best
> foot forward in showcasing your unique skills and abilities!
>
>
> We are excited to continue our conversations and find a career opportunity
> for you at Cytracom!
>
>
>

>

>

>
>
> This is a remote position with *Northern Trust* for the role of *Lead AWS
> AI Cloud Engineer*. The maximum rate for this position is *$80/hr on W2.*
> As this is an urgent requirement, the client is looking to onboard someone
> within a week.
>
>
>
> If you're comfortable with the rate of *$80/hr on W2,* please confirm so
> I can go ahead and submit your profile for the next steps in the process.
>
>
>
>
>
> *Looking forward to your response. *
>
>
>
>
>
> *Location: Cincinnati, OH.  Remote (EST hours a must)*.  Candidates must

>
>
>    - *IMPORTANT NOTES:* This person would be part of a high-impact team
>    pushing the boundaries of cloud-native AI in a real-world enterprise
>    setting. This is not a prompt-engineering sandbox or a resume keyword trap. *If
>    they’ve merely dabbled in SageMaker, mentioned RAG on LinkedIn, or read
>    about vector search—this isn’t the right fit.* We’re looking for
>    candidates who have *architected, developed, and supported AI/ML
>    services in production environments. *This is a builder’s role within
>    a Public Cloud AWS Engineering team. They aren’t hiring buzzword lists or
>    conference attendees. If they’ve built something they’re proud
>    of—especially if it involved real infrastructure, real data, and real
>    users. If they are still learning, that’s great too—but this isn’t an
>    entry-level role or a theory-only position.
>    - *This is a lead role: MUST HAVE*
>
>
>    - *Minimum *7-10 years of experience
>
>
>    - Direct, hands-on development of RAG, semantic search, or
>    LLM-augmented applications, and using frameworks and ML tooling like
>    Transformers, PyTorch, TensorFlow, and LangChain—not just experimentation
>    in a notebook.
>    - Experience with AWS services, especially Bedrock, SageMaker, ECS,
>    and Lambda
>    - Must have a coding background
>    - Must have hands on generative AI experience
>    - Not interested in "paper architects or people leaders"
>    - Looking for builders and doers
>    - Hands on experience delivering in production environments
>    - Must have coding background (Python/ GoLang)
>    - Would prefer people with FinOps background but it is not required
>
>
>
> *Job Description: *
>
>    - Seeking a very strong Lead AI AWS Cloud Engineer III who has
>    actually built AI/ML applications in cloud—not just read about them.
>    - This role centers on hands-on development of retrieval-augmented
>    generation (RAG) systems, fine-tuning LLMs, and AWS-native microservices
>    that drive automation, insight, and governance in an enterprise
>    environment.
>    - Design and deliver scalable, secure services that bring large
>    language models into real operational use—connecting them to live
>    infrastructure data, internal documentation, and system telemetry.
>
>
>
> *Duties & Responsibilities: *
>
>    - Develop and maintain modular AI services on AWS using

>

> •             Identify long- and short-term cloud goals and translate them
> into actionable strategies.

> •             Work with senior leadership to align cloud initiatives with
> business objectives.

instruction: Write a professional email to: sam@softhqinc.com
input: Subject: Re: Reply Requested: DevSecOps Architect | Plano, TX | 12+ Months | Phone/Video Interview
output:
Interested but I'm very busy so please use email. If this is a good match
then we can chat.

//adam

*Adam Peacock*

Principal Architect
Office: +1-214-810-5701


On Wed, May 21, 2025 at 12:04 PM Sam j <sam@softhqinc.com> wrote:

> Hi Adam,
> Any interest in the below given opportunity?
>
> *Role:- DevSecops Architect *
> *Location:- Plano, TX(Onsite Role)*
> *Duration:- 12+ Months*
> *Mode of Interview:- Phone/Video*
>
>
> *Technical Skills Required:*
>
>    - *Git Repository Migration:* Proven experience migrating Git
>    repositories between platforms (strong preference for *GitLab to
>    GitHub*). Deep understanding of Git internals and migration strategies.
>    - *CI/CD Pipelines:* Extensive experience designing, implementing, and
>    maintaining *Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)
>    pipelines*.
>    - *GitHub Actions:* Strong proficiency with *GitHub Actions* and the
>    GitHub ecosystem, including workflow syntax and best practices.
>    - *TypeScript:* Experience developing custom *GitHub Actions using
>    TypeScript* is highly desirable.
>    - *Containerization:* Solid understanding of *containerization
>    technologies (Docker)* and container orchestration (*AWS ECS and EKS*).
>    - *Kubernetes Interaction:* Proficiency in using *kubectl* for
>    interacting with Kubernetes clusters (specifically EKS in this context).
>    - *Package Management (Kubernetes):* Experience with *Helm* for
>    managing Kubernetes applications.
>    - *Build and Dependency Management:* Experience with build tools and
>    dependency management for:
>       - *Java:* Maven, Gradle
>       - *Node.js:* NPM, Yarn
>       - *Python:* pip
>    - *Git:* Strong command-line *Git skills* and understanding of Git
>    workflows (e.g., Gitflow, trunk-based development).
>    - *Cloud Infrastructure:* Familiarity with *AWS services* relevant to
>    application hosting (ECS, EKS).
>    - *Deployment Automation:* Experience with deployment tools, ideally
>    including *Argo CD* for GitOps-based deployments.
>    - *Infrastructure as Code (IaC):* Strong proficiency in *Terraform*,
>    and awareness of *Terraform Cloud* is highly welcome.
>    - *Scripting:* Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Bash, Python,
>    Java) for automation tasks.
>    - *Problem Solving:* Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills
>    related to build, test, and deployment processes.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>

> We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced AWS Cloud Architect /
> DevOps Engineer with a strong background in designing and implementing
> robust AWS architectures, disaster recovery solutions, and cloud-native
> applications. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with Amazon
> EKS, Docker & Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform, CI/CD pipelines (GitLab,
> Jenkins), and cloud migrations. This role demands a proactive
> problem-solver with strong communication skills and the ability to
> collaborate with Product team and lead offshore teams.
> ________________________________________
> Key Responsibilities:
> • Design and implement scalable, secure, and highly available AWS
> architectures, including multi-region redundancy and Disaster Recovery (DR)
> strategies.
> • Deploy and manage containerized applications using Amazon EKS (Docker &
> Kubernetes). Experience with Helm charts deployment is an added advantage.
> • Build and manage infrastructure using Terraform, following
> Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) principles.
> • Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines using tools such as GitLab, GitHub,
> and Jenkins, preferably using declarative pipeline approaches.
> • Lead and participate in cloud migration projects (on-prem to AWS or
> cloud-to-cloud), including application (monolithic to microservices) and
> database migration strategies.
> • Collaborate with development teams to integrate DevOps processes into
> Java Spring Boot and microservices architectures.
> • Interface directly with Product, understanding requirements and
> delivering high-quality solutions.
> • Create design documents, architectural diagrams, and operational
> documentation for various AWS services.
> • Ensure cloud security compliance, including SSL certificate management,
> IAM policies, encryption, and WAF configurations.
> • Setup and manage monitoring and observability solutions including
> Grafana, Splunk, ELK and Cloud Watch.
> • Guide and mentor offshore teams, ensuring smooth execution of project
> goals and timelines.
>
> Must-Have Technical Skills:
> • Strong hands-on expertise in AWS Services EKS, EFS, EC2, S3, Route 53,
> WAF, SNS, SQS, SES, KMS, Load Balancers, CloudFront, CloudWatch, etc.
> • Deep understanding of Kubernetes, Helm, and Docker.
> • Proficiency in Terraform for infrastructure provisioning and maintenance.
> • Experience with CI/CD tools: GitLab (Declarative pipelines), GitHub,
> jenkins, git, etc..
> • Experience in cloud migrations, preferably to AWS.
> • Scripting proficiency in at least one language (Eg: Python, bash).
> • Understanding of cloud security, IAM policies, encryption, and

> <http://eateam.conrep.com/conrep/actions/mail/unsubscribe.php?param=QVBSSUQ9MzA1MDAxNjA1MzczJkFQTUlEPTQzMCZDTVBDRD05MDAyNCZGUk9NPWpvZUBlYXRlYW0uY29tJlRPPWFwZWFjb2NrQGFxb3JuLmNvbSZKT0JJRD0zMDUwNzUyODg5MDQmdXNyaWQ9MzA1MDAwMDEyNTg5JkpCQ0lEPTMwNTA3NTI4ODkwNCZJTlRDVD0mb25lQ2xrVW5zdWI9MQ==>

> Hi,
>
>
>
> *Need Chief Technology Advisor- Remote with Travel-Sure Interview*
>
> *Location: Remote (USA)*
>
> *Duration: 12+Months*
>
>
>
> Travel:
>
> • Travel to various Ensono locations and client sites will be frequent;
> estimated 25% of weeks will involve travel, more in first year of role for
> on-boarding and client engagement.
>
>
>
>
>
> Job Description:
>
> Expert Solution Architects are seasoned technologists focused on promoting
> technical innovation and transformation aligned with our client’s business
> drivers and corporate objectives to drive value-based outcomes. They also
> provide client and industry feedback to Ensono’s internal teams, which
> allows us to adjust our product and technology roadmaps.
>
> The Solution Architect (SA) team works alongside and supports the Sales,
> Consulting, Operations and Service Management organizations to service
> largest and most strategic clients. They work with the clients’ business
> and technical teams to create reference architecture frameworks and
> templates. They lead the effort to execute multi-year transformation
> initiatives in the clients’ environments. SAs also help the account teams
> identify, pursue and close strategic business development opportunities
> while driving add-on business within existing accounts. As part of this,
> SAs must be effective in fostering executive level relationships with an
> emphasis on client satisfaction. Throughout the engagement process, from
> discovery to solution implementation, an SA must work with and often lead
> multi-disciplinary teams. Ultimately, the SA remains of the owner of the
> technical design of a client’s environment.
>
>
>
> Responsibilities:
>
> • Inform client about emerging technologies pertinent to their
> infrastructure needs
>
> • Interpret business opportunities, changes, and challenges within our
> clients’ environments and work across organizational boundaries to drive
> short and long-term technology roadmaps which will create value for our
> clients and Ensono
>
> • Enable alignment of business objectives with IT roadmaps using analysis
> of the technology landscape to identify gaps, potential impact, technical
> debt, etc. and recommend solutions to support business objectives (cost
> optimization, improved operations, sustainability, etc.)
>
> • Advocate for - and drive adoption of – standard reference architectures,
> good technology design patterns, and solution principles that align with
> the client’s business objectives.
>
> • Work closely with client IT staff and their business leaders to promote
> end-to-end solutions using design patterns for mainframe, open systems, and
> cloud, across vendors and providers such as AWS/Azure/GCP, IBM, Dell, etc.
>
> • Collaborate with the Sales and Consulting organizations to create
> Pursuit, Solution, and Sales strategies for existing clients
>
> • Conduct discovery and assessment workshops (often in collaboration with
> resources from consulting, operations and product teams) to help drive
> further penetration of the client account
>
> • Develop and document solutions that meet client's (technical and
> business) requirements and allow them to adapt to changing industry needs
> with a focus on transformation and re-platform efforts
>
> • Conduct solution development sessions and present technical solutions
> and busin

*Adam Peacock*

On Wed, May 14, 2025 at 12:06 PM <raj.sharma@compunnel.com> wrote:

>
> Greetings,
>
> My name is Rajat Sharma from Compunnel Inc. I saw your profile in one the
> job boards and feel that your skills and professional experience would be a
> good fit for a position with one of our premier clients. Please review the
> job description below. if you are interested in this position, please
> forward your update resume for immediate consideration.
>
> *Job Title: T**echnical Lead-Cloud & Infra Engg*
>
> *Location – 100% Remote*
>
> *Duration: Full Time Permanent*
>
> *JOB DESCRIPTION:*
>
> *Job Duties & Responsibilities:*
> • Responsible to deliver Cloud IAM solution implementation and operations
> within multiple ARTs
> • Owns day to day activities for ARTs with Cloud IAM solution,
> implementation, architecture feasibility
> • Liaise between Cloud IAM Engineering, BAU and ARTs/ Engineering teams to
> effectively collaborate Cloud IAM engineering requirements, efforts and
> outcomes with ART roadmap and deliverables
> o Operates in a Hub – spoke model, as a Cloud IAM SME for each ART assigned
> o Participates and contributes to PI planning meetings in their assigned
> ART
> o Understands the projects that are deployed on AWS and comprehends
> dependency on IAM team
> o Does feasibility study on the task Accepts/diverts to other teams based
> on the study
> o Collaborate with Risk, Assurance and other teams in defining and
> managing controls for Cloud IAM
> o Understands the requirements that come from ART team for Role
> Creation/modification
> • Operationalize ART-level work intake, Incidents, issues and manage the
> backlog required to enable ARTs to migrate and adapt Cloud platform
> standardization
> o Conducts roles’ permissions security and compliance checks with CIE
> restricting requirements
> o Creates Service Tickets and obtains approvals from role owners and
> accounts
> o Prepares templates as needed for Ops (BAU) team
> o Facilitates expediting specific access requests
> o Provides break-fix troubleshooting support for the ART through ITIL
> Incidents.
> • Drive implementation within ARTs adhering Cloud IAM standards, best
> practices and Synchrony security/ governance expectations
> o Maintains access to architectural designs and documentation for the
> products in the ART
> o Own ART-level backlog, work intake and tickets for their respective ARTs
> • Provides Sprint updates to RTEs and Product Owners.
>
> *Technical Skills:*
> • 4+ years of experience engineering AWS IAM and/or AWS Security solutions.
> • 7+ years of experience developing automated solutions using Python
> scripts, modules, and/or packages for managing AWS configuration.
> • 4+ years of experience in planning, building, & managing AWS IAM
> Policies, SAML Roles, Cross-Account Roles, Service-Link Roles, and applying
> access conditions & restrictions.
> • 4+ years of experience in the development & operational support of AWS
> IAM processes, application integrations, vulnerability management, workload
> support, regulatory compliance, and service delivery/management.
> • 4+ years of experience developing Infrastructure-as-Code solutions via
> Terraform.
> • 5+ years in CI/CD automation using industry standard tools (Bitbucket,
> Jenkins, EKS, ECR, Chef etc.) DevOps & CI/CD best practices.
> • AWS / Cloud IAM implementation with AWS IAM, Identity Center, Access
> Analyzer and all associated AWS PaaS, IaaS services
> • Strong understanding of identity and access management principles and
> best practices on AWS.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>

>
>
> As an Enterprise Data and AI/ML Architect, you will be responsible to lead
> the architecture and design of Data Platform and leverage it for AI/ML
> solutions. Reporting to the Director, Architecture you will:
>
>
>
>    - Lead the Architecture and design of business and tech initiatives

wrote:

>> On Wed, May 7, 2025 at 2:44 PM Selena Peacock <selenavpeacock@gmail.com>
>> wrote:
>>
>>> Hello,
>>>
>>> Regarding your question about taxes: the 2024 taxes should not be a
>>> problem, as you properly requested an extension. However, you will need to
>>> file your 2023 taxes for your parents’ applications to ultimately be
>>> approved, since the extension period for 2023 has ended. We should still be
>>> okay to go ahead and file the applications now, and that way your parents
>>> can receive their Social Security numbers. However, USCIS will almost
>>> certainly issue a Request for Evidence (RFE) asking for the 2023 tax
>>> documentation. Once they do, they’ll give us a deadline to submit that
>>> information—so it will be important to get your 2023 taxes filed as soon as
>>> possible.
>>>
>>> Best regards,
>>>
>>> Cesar Rivera Infante
>>>
>>

output:

Three cheers for laziness.

*Adam Peacock*

Principal Architect
Office: +1-214-810-5701


On Wed, May 7, 2025 at 2:44 PM Selena Peacock <selenavpeacock@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Hello,
>
> Regarding your question about taxes: the 2024 taxes should not be a
> problem, as you properly requested an extension. However, you will need to
> file your 2023 taxes for your parents’ applications to ultimately be
> approved, since the extension period for 2023 has ended. We should still be
> okay to go ahead and file the applications now, and that way your parents
> can receive their Social Security numbers. However, USCIS will almost
> certainly issue a Request for Evidence (RFE) asking for the 2023 tax
> documentation. Once they do, they’ll give us a deadline to submit that
> information—so it will be important to get your 2023 taxes filed as soon as
> possible.
>
> Best regards,
>
> Cesar Rivera Infante
>

instruction: Write a professional email to: amita@anveta.com
input: Subject: Re: Principal Infrastructure Architect- Full Time
output:
Interested but I'm very busy so please use email. If this is a good match
then we can chat.

//adam

*Adam Peacock*

Principal Architect
Office: +1-214-810-5701


On Wed, May 7, 2025 at 9:16 AM Amita Negi <amita@anveta.com> wrote:

> *Principal Infrastructure Architect*
>
> *Client: Highmark Health*
>
> *Remote (Pittsburgh/Camp Hill, PA -occasional meetings. Travel will be
> covered.)*
>
> *Full-time employment*
>
>
>
> *Summery:*
>
> cloud architect-infrastructure architect working with systems, network and
> cloud.
>
> The Principal Infrastructure Architect serves as one of the most senior
> infrastructure architects and technologists in the company. This person
> will be instrumental in turning strategy into practical, pattern-based
> architecture in alignment with business needs. The candidate will regularly
> interact with senior level leadership, simplifying complex problems and
> needs into a relatable narrative that enhances decision making. They will
> act as a driver for infrastructure strategy, championing the direction and
> synergies across our business units and corporate functions. This job will
> act as a "technology visionary" for infrastructure, with the ability to
> influence strategy and behaviors within areas of responsibility and
> throughout the company. This job requires experience in all areas of
> architecture with an emphasis on infrastructure and cloud technologies. The
> ability to communicate and deliver a meaningful story at all levels of the
> organization and to our customers is essential. This job requires a high
> level of skill in driving and influencing business outcomes and consensus
> driven decisions.
>
>
>
> *RESPONSIBILITIES*
>
> •              Work with the business stakeholders to develop Enterprise
> Architecture deliverables that articulate the business strategy, business
> outcomes, business capabilities and other elements needed to support
> business outcomes such as investment and cost analysis.
>
> •              Develop and implement the company’s technology innovation
> agenda to ensure that the company is a leader in the application of
> technology to our various businesses. Interface with the businesses and
> executive management on strategies with alignment to technology and
> innovation.
>
> •              Develop and maintain Solutions enterprise-wide technology
> architecture strategy which catalogues the existing architectures,
> identifies areas for synergies and provides guidelines to maximize the
> return on investment across the enterprise.
>
> •              Provide leadership and direction to integrate architecture
> best practices into critical processes and disciplines such as
> acquisition/purchasing, vendor management, portfolio/program management and
> project management.
>
> •              Develop the solution architecture function to support the
> companies most important and complex initiatives.
>
> •              Other duties as assigned or requested.
>
>
>
> *Required Qualifications:*
>
> •              10+ years of experience in IT infrastructure with at least
> 3 years in a senior or principal architect role.
>
> •              Proven expertise in designing large-scale, distributed
> infrastructure systems in hybrid cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure,
> Google Cloud).
>
> •              Deep understanding of network architecture, storage
> solutions, virtualization, containers, and automation frameworks (e.g.,
> Terraform, Ansible).
>
> •              Strong knowledge of cybersecurity principles and
> infrastructure hardening.
>
> •              Experience with disaster recovery planning, high
> availability design, and capacity planning.
>
> •              Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder
> management skills.
>
> •              Relevant certifications preferred (e.g., AWS Solutions
> Architect – Professional, Azure Solutions Arch

instruction: Write a professional email to: yogesh@veritosolutionsinc.com
input: Subject: Re: Sr. Storage (Ceph) Engineer ||Manhattan, NYC (Onsite)
output:
*Adam Peacock*

Principal Architect
Office: +1-214-810-5701


On Fri, May 2, 2025 at 1:57 PM Yogesh sharma <yogesh@veritosolutionsinc.com>
wrote:

> *Sr. Storage (Ceph) Engineer*
> *Manhattan, NYC (Onsite) *
> Phone + Skype
> Job description: The Team has provisioned an on-premise Ceph storage
> cluster to support a compute cluster, primarily by providing RADOS Block
> Device (RBD) volumes. We are now looking to expand this storage cluster to
> support further use cases by growing its capacity (currently at 12
> petabytes) and offer storage to a wider audience. A critical component of
> this new offering is a Ceph distributed file system (CephFS) that will be
> mounted on Linux machines.
>
> Assist with the deployment and configuration of CephFS
> Monitor for issues and performance concerns with the file systems,
> clients, or the underlying infrastructure
> Integrate Ceph with our backup solution
> Advise and monitor the integration of the file system with HPC compute
> machines running Linux
> Write documentation for the cluster and its setup both for internal use
> (for cluster administrators) and external use (for our end-users, the
> researchers using the file system for various research activities)
> Analyze researchers’ use cases and help them adjust their workflow or tune
> the system towards their goals
>
> Required Qualifications:
> At least one year experience with Ceph and the Ceph file system is
> required. Advanced
> knowledge of Linux system administration and performance monitoring is
> required.
> Excellent verbal, analytical, project management and technical problem
> solving skills. Ability to communicate technical information to a
> non-technical audience. Strong work ethic to collaborate as a group, but
> also can carry a project to its end with minimal direction on your own.
>
> Preferred Qualifications:
> Knowledge of networking concepts such as the OSI model, DNS, firewalls,
> proxies, load
> balancing is required. Advanced concepts like BGP, VXLAN, and the
> Cisco/ARISTA/SONiC
> platforms are a plus.
> Experience with programming languages such as C, C++
> Golang, Rust is desirable.
> Experience with Kubernetes and CSI plugins is a plus.
> Familiarity with the Prometheus/Grafana monitoring stack is a plus.
>
> Yogesh Sharma | Lead Tech Recruiter
> E: Yogesh@veritosolutions.com
> P: +1 201-627-7507
>
> Disclaimer: We respect your Online Privacy. Under Bill S.1618 Title III
> passed by the 105th U.S. Congress, this mail cannot be considered Spam as
> long as we include contact information and a method to be removed from our
> mailing list. If you are not interested in receiving our emails, then
> please send an email to Remove@veritosolutions.com with 'Remove' in the
> subject line, we will remove your email ID from our list and send you a
> confirmation. We apologize for any inconvenience.
>
